meanings.definition: Engaging in a competition or rivalry.
meanings.sent1: The two friends were contesting in a friendly game of chess.
meanings.sent2: The athletes were contesting for the gold medal in the race.
meanings.sent3: The siblings were contesting in a playful game of tag.
meanings.sent4: The birds were contesting for the best spot on the feeder.
meanings.sent5: The students were contesting in a spelling bee competition.

meanings.definition: Challenging the validity or accuracy of something.
meanings.sent1: The lawyer was contesting the evidence presented in court.
meanings.sent2: The scientist was contesting the results of the experiment.
meanings.sent3: The detective was contesting the suspect's alibi.
meanings.sent4: The journalist was contesting the accuracy of the news report.
meanings.sent5: The student was contesting the teacher's grading of the test.

meanings.definition: Participating in a debate or argument.
meanings.sent1: The contesting teams were preparing their arguments for the debate.
meanings.sent2: The contesting politicians were discussing their viewpoints on the issue.
meanings.sent3: The contesting siblings were arguing over who gets the last cookie.
meanings.sent4: The contesting colleagues were debating the best approach to the project.
meanings.sent5: The contesting students were passionately presenting their case in the competition.
